column2: Lorzgld12, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: In the morning I have trouble waking up with dizziness, nausea, and unstable walking. This medicine took care of all of these symptoms so far. However, I do feel the dried up feeling associated with antihistamines.

column2: Erin, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I take either, this, Bonine chewable, or Dramamine for nausea from a duodenal Ulcer that I have.  It helps me get threw my work day!  I hate the way the Bonine chewable taste, I almost gag on it, I wish the store I work at sold the ones that you can swallow instead, like Dramamine.  But its cheaper and causes less drowsiness.

column2: db, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have used Bonine for years while Scuba Diving. It is awesome. No dry mouth. No drowsiness. It is safe to use with barometric concerns and it lasts all day. I take it the evening before the dive, and again in the morning before boarding the boat.

column2: Josie, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on numerous cruises, some incurred very high seas (40'waves & 60 mph wind).  Bonine worked great for me!  Before using Bonine I had problems with all types of motion. No more.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
Con, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I take it when I am at work, and cannot get water to swallow a pill.  My symptoms occur if I consume too much caffeine, usually coffee.  This drug is effective on one dose.  Now that I am 60 yr old, I use the children's chewable.

column2: Danny P, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I use it as an anti-nauseal when deep sea fishing.  It is easily available at the local pharmacy in both adult and child dosages.  I've given the children's dissolvable to my 10 year old who doesn't even like the taste of Flintstones vitamins, and it works for him as well.  He is very prone to motion sickness; car, plane, boat; bonine does the trick for him.  Most of my extended family and friends use it when on the ocean.  I used it in 7-8 foot seas in the Sea of Japan, and the only non-sailors not sick were the two of us on bonine.

column2: Vacation, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The medication did not make me drowsy nor did I feel nauseated.

column2: Sue, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this for motion sickness on a ship.  At first it worked on the ship but 1 day after my return I developed vertigo and had to go to the emergency room. Now it's 4 days later and I still feel lightheaded and dizzy. The doctor said it was the bonine. I took 4 pills in 7 days. That was way too much.

column2: sftball, 19-24 Female  (Patient)
55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I became very dizzy after use. I took three pills in a two day period, now 6 days later I am still experiencing dizziness.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Minimizes symptoms but doesn't erase them completely.

column2: koobaby, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I take this for vertigo and it makes me jumpy and jittery.  I have a prescription for Antivert and doesn't have the affect on me.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am currently taking Bonine for the prevention of dizziness. I Suffer from Meniere's disease and I find this medication a life saver.  I can work and go pretty much about my day. It does cause drowsiness but I can manage by staying busy. I recommend it for anyone who suffers Meniere's.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been having bouts of nausea and at first tried one tablet of the children's chewable form (bonine), it worked but made me drowsy so now I take a half tab of the children's chewable and I can function fine during the day without nausea,on occasion 1/4 tab works also. This drug is a life saver for me and am thankful it is sold over the counter.

column2: mejjy@aol.com, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am taking it for vertigo and it works very well in conjunction with a prescription drug. I am monitoring my blood pressure at least every six every six hours. So far, no problems at all. Will see my doctor this week,

column2: spike, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this for a viral inner ear infection which is causing bouts of vertigo.  I find the pill, taken as directed knocks me out cold, and if taken before bed cause me to wake very early not feeling well.  Half a pill seems to help to some degree, less tiredness, but still some nausea

column2: opatboy, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Got very sea sick, took Bonine and was feeling better immediately. Prevented further sea sickness even in heavy seas.
